author: Mr. Mc

review: This useful little gadget was a snap to set up and gives new functionality to my Macbook Pro, my iPad and my iPhone. You install it on a free HDMI port on your TV, download the app to your computer, and Bob's your uncle. Now anything I see within Chrome I can see on my TV. And of course, being a Google product, all YouTube videos are visible on my TV as well. I fired up YouTube on my iPhone and there were the videos on my big screen. Have videos in your hard drive? Use "Open File" on Chrome, run the videos within the browser, and they're on your big screen as well. The sound comes through loud and clear. All this for $35. Thank you, Google!

author: GoPSU

review: I was searching for this product because I own an Xbox and wanted to watch Netflix and youtube on my TV. However, It's a pain to have to pay for monthly XBox Gold Membership to use these apps on XBox server. This product is relatively cheap compared to Apple TV and other Microsoft devices that costs $99.00 not including cables and HDMI connector. The package arrived on time, the box was tiny and had everything that I would need to connect it to my TV, including the Chromecast itself, a charger (if your TV doesn't have a USB outlet) to charge the Chromecast, an HDMI cable (this supposingly boost your wifi reception and in case the Chromecast did not fit directly in your TV). Set up was very easy. I plug the devices in, turn on my laptop and download the Chromecast app. Install and set up took about 10 mins total. If you want to control Chromecast on your phone on Netflix and Youtube, there's an icon to press and it shows option to watch on your iphone or stream on TV. Super easy to use and navigate. Did exaclty what I bought it for: streaming my Netflix shows on TV. Only draw-back is on Netflix, you have to manually start a new episode, it doesn't automatically starts like on your laptop. Overall, I love it.

review: If you are a Verizon FIOS customer and you are NOT a techy person - DONT BUY THIS!!. Make sure you try seting up this device on a laptop, phone or desktop. If one doesnt work and connection is not establised - try another one. I had to try 3 different laptops. 3rd one was a charm after I changed the configuration on the router.If you have a Verizon Actiontech router you need to enable UNPN and disable IGMP. When you call Verizon - they will not help you. Menus to these items are disabled on the router. Even verizon tech will not now where they are. After a long search here is a workaround. You have to enable UNPS it with this link http://192.168.1.1/index.cgi?active_page=900 and you have to disable IGMP with this link http://192.168.1.1/index.cgi?active_page=6059. If that doesnt work then you are on your own. It tooke me a good 2 hrs or reasearch, 1hr wasted with stupid verizon tech that didnt help me a bit. Calling actiontech will not help you either.
